FR-2: The system shall allow users to specify the asset (stock, ETF, mutual fund) for automatic investment.
FR-3: The system shall allow users to specify the investment amount (either a fixed dollar amount or a percentage of available funds).
FR-4: The system shall automatically execute scheduled investments based on the configured schedule and asset availability.
FR-5: The system shall support recurring trade types including buy and sell orders.
FR-6: The system shall allow users to define a stop-loss or take-profit price for recurring sell orders.
FR-7: The system shall provide a user-friendly interface for setting up, modifying, and canceling automatic investments.
FR-8: The system shall display a summary of all active automatic investments, including schedule, asset, and amount.
FR-9: The system shall send notifications to the user before and after each automatic investment execution.
FR-10: The system shall store automatic investment schedules and configurations securely in a database.
FR-11: The system shall track the history of all executed automatic investments, including date, asset, amount, and price.
FR-12: The system shall prevent users from scheduling automatic investments that exceed their available funds.
FR-13: The system shall notify the user if an automatic investment fails due to insufficient funds or other errors.

NFR-1: The automatic investment execution process shall complete within 5 minutes of the scheduled time.
NFR-2: The system shall maintain 99.9% uptime for the automatic investment feature.
NFR-3: The user interface for managing automatic investments shall be responsive and load within 3 seconds.
NFR-4: All sensitive data related to automatic investments shall be encrypted at rest and in transit.
